sections.cachedMarkedDoc: Introduction

sections.doc_: This is a sample showing how to implement the "show more" design pattern. "Show more" is common design pattern used on e-commerce category pages to lazy load more content triggered by an user interaction.
sections.cachedMarkedDoc: This is a sample showing how to implement the "show more" design pattern. "Show more" is common design pattern used on e-commerce category pages to lazy load more content triggered by an user interaction.
sections.normalizedDoc_: This is a sample showing how to implement the "show more" design pattern. "Show more" is common design pattern used on e-commerce category pages to lazy load more content triggered by an user interaction.

sections.doc_: Additionally used AMP components must be imported in the header. We use `amp-list` for showing a list of products
sections.normalizedDoc_: Additionally used AMP components must be imported in the header. We use `amp-list` for showing a list of products

sections.doc_: We use `amp-bind` for dynamically changing the src of `amp-list`
sections.normalizedDoc_: We use `amp-bind` for dynamically changing the src of `amp-list`

sections.doc_: We use `amp-form` for making the call to get extra products after an user interaction
sections.normalizedDoc_: We use `amp-form` for making the call to get extra products after an user interaction

sections.doc_: We use `amp-mustache` for rendering the `amp-list` content
sections.normalizedDoc_: We use `amp-mustache` for rendering the `amp-list` content

sections.code:
<link rel="canonical" href="http://localhost:8080/documentation/examples/interactivity-dynamic-content/show_more_button/index.html">
  <title>Show More Button</title>

  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1">

  <style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>

  <style amp-custom>
    .list-item {
      border-radius: 2px;
      margin: 0.5rem;
      display: flex;
      align-items: center;
    }
    .list-item amp-img {
      flex-shrink: 0;
    }
  </style>
</head>
<body>

sections.doc_: ## How to implement a show more button

headings.name: How to implement a show more button

sections.normalizedDoc_: ## How to implement a show more button

sections.doc_:
You can implement a show more button by using `amp-list` with additional `load-more` attribute set to option `manual`.
The optional `load-more-bookmark` attribute specifies a field name in the returned data that will give the url of the next items to load. If not specified, `amp-list` expects the response object to have the `load-more-src` field set to the next url to load.
sections.code:
FALLBACK
PLACEHOLDER
ERROR END
sections.preview:
FALLBACK
PLACEHOLDER
ERROR END
sections.normalizedDoc_:
You can implement a show more button by using `amp-list` with additional `load-more` attribute set to option `manual`.
The optional `load-more-bookmark` attribute specifies a field name in the returned data that will give the url of the next items to load. If not specified, `amp-list` expects the response object to have the `load-more-src` field set to the next url to load.

sections.doc_: ## Show more using amp-list and amp-bind

headings.name: Show more using amp-list and amp-bind

sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Show more using amp-list and amp-bind

sections.doc_:
You can also implement a show more button manually by using `amp-list` and `amp-bind`, where
`amp-list` `src` data are bind to the value of an `amp-state` element. Here we are using two `amp-state`: `photos`
which uses the same json `src` as the `amp-list` so that will initially contain the same list of items ...
sections.normalizedDoc_:
You can also implement a show more button manually by using `amp-list` and `amp-bind`, where
`amp-list` `src` data are bind to the value of an `amp-state` element. Here we are using two `amp-state`: `photos`
which uses the same json `src` as the `amp-list` so that will initially contain the same list of items ...

sections.doc_: ... while the `amp-state` with id `product` is just used to implement the show-more logic where we are allowing the user to click 3 times.
sections.normalizedDoc_: ... while the `amp-state` with id `product` is just used to implement the show-more logic where we are allowing the user to click 3 times.

sections.doc_:
We bind the `src` attribute of the `amp-list` to the `amp-state` object containing the products

from that component as a `src`. We also dynamically change the height of the amp-list based on

the number of items (each item has a height of `108px`).
sections.normalizedDoc_:
We bind the `src` attribute of the `amp-list` to the `amp-state` object containing the products
   from that component as a `src`. We also dynamically change the height of the amp-list based on
   the number of items (each item has a height of `108px`).

sections.doc_:
The show more button is implemented via a form which triggers a page update on the `submit-success` event.

We are then merging the form results into the items already loaded by the `amp-state` using the `concat` function.
sections.code:
<form method="GET"
  action="/documentation/examples/api/photo-stream"
  action-xhr="/documentation/examples/api/photo-stream"
  target="_top"
  on="submit-success: AMP.setState({
            photos: {
              items: photos.items.concat(event.response.items)
            },
            product: {
              moreItemsPageIndex: product.moreItemsPageIndex - 1,
              hasMorePages: !!event.response.next
            }
          });">
  <input type="hidden"
    name="items"
    value="3">
  <input type="hidden"
    name="left"
    value="2"
    [value]="product.moreItemsPageIndex">
  <input type="submit"
    value="Show more"
    [hidden]="!product.hasMorePages">
</form>
sections.preview:
<form method="GET"
    action="/documentation/examples/api/photo-stream"
    action-xhr="/documentation/examples/api/photo-stream"
    target="_top"
    on="submit-success: AMP.setState({
              photos: {
                items: photos.items.concat(event.response.items)
              },
              product: {
                moreItemsPageIndex: product.moreItemsPageIndex - 1,
                hasMorePages: !!event.response.next
              }
            });">
    <input type="hidden"
      name="items"
      value="3">
    <input type="hidden"
      name="left"
      value="2"
      [value]="product.moreItemsPageIndex">
    <input type="submit"
      value="Show more"
      [hidden]="!product.hasMorePages">
  </form>
sections.normalizedDoc_:
The show more button is implemented via a form which triggers a page update on the `submit-success` event.
   We are then merging the form results into the items already loaded by the `amp-state` using the `concat` function.

<meta charset="utf-8">
  <script async src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0.js"></script>

  <script async custom-element="amp-list" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-list-0.1.js"></script>
  <script async custom-element="amp-bind" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-bind-0.1.js"></script>
  <script async custom-element="amp-form" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-form-0.1.js"></script>
  <script async custom-template="amp-mustache" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-mustache-0.2.js"></script>

  <link rel="canonical" href="http://localhost:8080/documentation/examples/interactivity-dynamic-content/show_more_button/index.html">
  <title>Show More Button</title>

  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1">

  <style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>
